page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY OF MORELEIGH
page.content:
In 1315 Moreleigh was granted a weekly Market and a Fair on two days in the year - both are now extinct. All Saints' Church is reputed to have been built in the late 13th Century as a penance by the Lord of the Manor - it stands at Place Barton, the site of the old Manor House. Petty Sessions used to be held monthly at the Inn.
THIS RECORD HAS BEEN COMPILED BY: MESDAMES DORA COX; JOAN GEALL; JENNY HEYGATE; ANDRE LEWIS; BARBARA SAVAGE; RUBY VOISK ALL MEMBERS OF ASHPRINGTON W.I. DEVON
